page.title: 12THE FARM MANAGER (2 of 2)
page.content: THE VITAL COLOSTRUM AS YOU PROBABLY WOULDN'T KNOW,BUT THIS IS VITAL TO A NEW_BORN CALF.IT WARDS OFF ANY BUGS THAT THEY MAY HAVE,BUT HE HAS DONE QUITE WELL WITHOUT IT.SO WE ARE KEEPING OUR FINGERS CROSSED ON HIM.THIS BIG CHAP HE DIDN'T HAVE QUITE SUCH A GOOD START IN LIFE,BECAUSE HE HAD A VERY LONG BIRTH.AS YOU CAN SEE HE IS QUITE A BIG BOY,HIS LUNGS TOOK QUITE A PACING,AND HE'S HAD PNEUMONIA QUITE A FEW TIMES.AT THE MOMENT WE'RE KEEPING OUR FINGERS CROSSED THAT HE'LL NOW OVERCOME IT AS HE'S NOW MUCH LARGER,BUT TOMORROW HE'LL PROBABLY HAVE A TEMPERATURE AND THEN IT WILL BE ANTIBIOTICS.BUT THE THING IS WE TEND TO LOOK ON THEM MORE AS PETS.
